Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.11682065]Gram-positive bacterium:Micrococcus luteus(MIC=2.5μg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Shigella dysenteriae(MIC=10μg/ml), Klebsiella pneumoniae(MIC=10μg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=100μg/ml), Salmonella typhimurium(MIC=22.5μg/ml), Proteus mirabilis(MIC>200μg/ml), Serratia marcescens(MIC>200μg/ml);Yeast:Candida albicans(MIC=150μg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref:11682065] It has 0.9% hemolytic activity at 100μg/ml against human red blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Thanks to its single linear amphipathic alpha-helix, may integrate into membrane phospholipids, leading to lysis of the membrane. Shows antibacterial activity against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria and against the fungus C. albicans. Has weak hemolytic activity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: Structural study of novel antimicrobial peptides, nigrocins, isolated from Rana nigromaculata.
Literature.Author: Park S, Park SH, Ahn HC, Kim S, Kim SS, Lee BJ, Lee BJ.
